channel.title: I2c or midi for Tesseract Sweet Sixteen to Axoloti
channel.description: The Sweet Sixteen kit will be arriving soon and I will be using it partially as a cv input converter for Axoloti. Are there any advantages to i2c vs midi as far as bandwidth or resolution of data? The Sweet Sixteen can convert cv to both i2c and midi.

item.title: I2c or midi for Tesseract Sweet Sixteen to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @Dolphinwolf Jeffrey David Anderson
item.description:
@Dolphinwolf wrote:

Thank you for the clarification. I will use the midi protocol.

Read full topic
item.source: I2c or midi for Tesseract Sweet Sixteen to Axoloti

item.title: I2c or midi for Tesseract Sweet Sixteen to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @tele_player
item.description:
@tele_player wrote:

MIDI will certainly be simpler, since it is a more completely standardized protocol.

The Axoloti hardware certainly supports I2C, but I don’t think there’s any Axoloti implementation of the higher protocol layers needed to use it for controllers.

Read full topic
item.source: I2c or midi for Tesseract Sweet Sixteen to Axoloti

item.title: I2c or midi for Tesseract Sweet Sixteen to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @Dolphinwolf Jeffrey David Anderson
item.description:
@Dolphinwolf wrote:

I am guessing by the silence that I should use the midi functionality of the two devices.

Read full topic
